performances.title: ¡Viva Mayhem!
performances.long_description: ¡Viva Mayhem! invites you to dance, sing, and wear your heart on your sleeve. An eight-piece post-wave ska band out of Ithaca, NY, ¡VM! has a stellar female lead, a rockin' rhythm section and a tight hornline. Together, their sound is raw, original, and true.

performances.title: Alan Rose and Restless Elements
performances.long_description: A quick list of influences combines names you’ll recognize like Springsteen, Costello, and Simon and Garfunkel with names you might not, like Crenshaw, Bragg, and Whiskeytown. Years of record collecting, including stints as a reviewer for Webster’s Weekly (one of the first web-only periodicals) and as a writer for 14850.com magazine, have given him a depth of musical knowledge and a taste for the obscure. All of this listening has helped Alan develop a talent for turning universal emotions into memorable lyrics. Combine that with an ear for marrying those lyrics to hook-filled memories and you have songs that engage listeners on multiple levels.

performances.title: Alexander Bradshaw Band
performances.long_description: Singer songwriter backed by local powerhouse players. Take a listen to the live demo linked above from the Ithaca is Music podcast series and enjoy!

performances.title: Alicia Freedman
performances.long_description: created A Little Lighter and Belly Dance Body & Soul as a way to fuse art and food. A way to make it fun and sensual to take care of ourselves. My dream is that this project touches your life and leaves you feeling lighter, graceful and grateful with every bite and every step.

performances.title: Andrew Alling
performances.long_description: One man original indy folk rock jam band

performances.title: Angie Beeler
performances.long_description: Miss Angie Beeler has music in her bones and has not gone a day in her life without a song.

performances.title: Answer the Muse
performances.long_description: Answer the Muse is a highly infectious, positive musical journey that weaves together relevant original rock/pop music, theatrical moments and audience participation in every show. Our signature sound includes tight vocal harmonies, exotic instrumentation and expansive arrangements. Audiences feel moved, inspired and "crazy happy".

performances.title: Anthony Kannon
performances.long_description: Artist from Upstate NY. Smacked Records 🤙🏼

performances.title: Arthur B and the Planetary Mix
performances.description: elestial grooves for the celebration of life!
performances.long_description: Arthur B and The Planetary Mix is a modern R n B influenced group, bringing on stellar sounds framed in an old school style. With original songs that are at once fresh and new, but also timeless and classic, this is music to dance to, sing with, and celebrate life. The band's live performances have been described as "A rare treat" and "Pure soul healing". Their much anticipated debut CD will be released in early 2019.

performances.title: Auntie Emo's Ukulele Showcase or Workshop
performances.long_description: Ukulele music, either in a workshop, or by various local ukulele performers. Generally happy, but sometimes blue(sy)

performances.title: Ave Mack
performances.long_description: Ave Mack was born Rahmel Mack on January 27, in Brooklyn, NY. Ave's childhood in Brooklyn left him wanting more out of his life than what he saw around him. Always interested in music and rhymes, Ave began writing while still young, but thought that a life and career in music was an impossible dream. It wasn't until recent years that he began to realize what he really wanted out of life for himself and for those around him,and began focusing seriously on his music. His lyrical style and content is heavily influenced by his experiences growing up in the Red Hook projects, as well as by the people and friends that he has worked with musically; Trey Skoolz, Dj Dream, TerrorDome, Rising Sun & The GunPoets, Silvaa, Dj Sma,Ra Dollas, Krayze & Hot, Youngin,Willie" Champ" Monroe, Jae Prodigy, Caleo Latin bay, Lil Jay,D-Rock, Eazy Thai Boy, Money Mars,Korey Bolden, Dj Davito, Yung Eddie. Like many of us, Ave Mack is inspired by the career and musical accomplishments of Shawn Carter (Jay-Z), also a Brooklyn native, who struggled with poverty and crime and rejection in the music game before becoming one of the most influential figures in hip hop today. Ave's alias is a reference to both the ave where he grew up in Red Hook, paired with his families government name; representing where he came from by making it a part of who he hopes to become. Ave has performed primarily in upstate NY; his music has been featured on the Tim Westwood Show in the UK and select songs can also be found on mixtapes in New York and Georgia

performances.title: Blue Cayuga Jazz
performances.long_description: Jazz. Piano, banjo, bass. Original music + selected modern jazz pieces.

performances.title: Bob Keefe and the Surf Renegades
performances.long_description: Bob Keefe and the Surf Renegades is the ONLY surf rock band in the Southern Tier (NY). With the standard quartet lineup of lead and rhythm guitars, bass guitar, and drums, their music is true to the Southern California surf scene of the 1960's.

performances.title: Boynton Middle School Chamber Orchestra
performances.long_description: The Boynton Chamber Orchestra is 26-member string orchestra consisting of Boynton Middle School's most dedicated young musicians. The talented students of the BCO will perform an exciting and varied program consisting of baroque, classical, popular and contemporary music.

performances.title: Corey Loveless
performances.long_description: Im a local hip hop artist speaking on topics ranging from fun party tracks to songs on mental health and addiction, myself and my producer and engineer would perform together him as the dj and myself as the emcee

performances.title: Danielle Ponder and the Tomorrow People
performances.long_description:
When Danielle Ponder and the Tomorrow People hit the stage things get torqued up quickly like a tent revival during tornado season. Named Top Ten Bands to watch by CityPaper, and winner of the 2015 and 2016 Roc Awards, "Best Band", Danielle Ponder and the Tomorrow People transcend musical genres with a blast of deep, powerful groove and soul. The band is the groove while Ponder’s pipes keep it rooted in soul. And according to Ponder, soul is more than a sound.

“Soul music is something you feel,” she says. “It gives you goose bumps.” This Rochester, NY Native has spent the past years rendering goose bumps by perfecting her style and charismatic performance. She sings, you listen, you melt. The result of her focus and dedication is a tone that is both enchanting and seductive along with a riveting, honest stage presence. It is this voice that has helped her secure gigs opening up for powerhouses such as George Clinton, Ledisi and The Roots. The band has also completed two successful European tours. Boyd Kletter of Bourbon Street Blues Club in Amsterdam said "Danielle shines bright both on and off the stage. She's truly is a star!" In 2016 the singer released her debut EP Blow Out The Sun. Soultracks.com said “Ponder’s vocals combine the spirit of the church with the speak-truth- to-power assertiveness of a movement leader. “ Jeff Spevak of the Democrat & Chronicle wrote "Ponder’s tough-sounding vocals on “Three Word Revolution (I Love Myself)” is a defiant call to self worth. That title track feels custom built as a room-shaking anthem for women in the audience.” In 2016 the band would also enter the AfroPunk Battle of the Bands contest, where they surpassed hundreds of bands and made it to the final four. Beyond Danielle's musical talent, she is a passionate defense attorney, speaker and activist. Danielle has dedicated the past 15 years to organizing and speaking up for marginalized communities. She has worked on issues such as education funding, women's rights, and has spent the past 8 years working for criminal justice reform. Danielle was recently highlighted by the American Bar Association. In 2017 she created the Multi-Media show "For the Love of Justice", where she shines light on our criminal justice system through powerful lyrics and thought provoking visuals. Dr. Karen Stote of WIlfred Laurier University called " For the Love of Justice" an "impactful and uplifting performance" This sensational singer lists powerful influences that lit her fuse like Nina Simone, Big Mama Thornton, Shirley Chilsolm, Cornel West and Lauryn Hill. Ponder opens her mouth to sing or speak and it’s readily apparent; there’s another name that belongs in that pantheon as well. Danielle Ponder, and her time is now.

performances.title: Danza Romani (Gypsy Dance)
performances.long_description: Danza Romani (Gypsy Dance) - Brings the excitement of Romani (Gypsy) dances from Russia, Spain, Turkey and the Balkans through the variety of music, dance and costumes of these countries. A showcase of the diverse and beautiful dances of the Romani people.

performances.title: Delta Blues by Gerard Burke
performances.long_description: acoustic Delta blues w/ vocal

performances.title: Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts
performances.long_description: Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts is one of those "good ole" country/western bands. Hints of Hank, Merle, and George give every song it's prominent roots influence but the songs remain obviously personal and honest. Drew, from California, moved here in 2017 and began writing original songs about travelin, boozin, and breakin hearts....mostly his own. Backed by local music scene heros: Joe Hayward on banjo/pedal steel (Ithaca Bottom Boys), Seth Gregory on stand-up bass (Mill Bastards/Pine Box), and Sid Burke on fiddle (Mill Bastards/Pine Box), the sound is authentic and timeless. From busking for dollars, to becoming a headlining act, Drew Kiddoo and the Blackouts has recently evolved adding Tristen Ross on mandolin (Ithaca Bottom Boys), Jason Shegogue on electric guitar (Lady D and the Shadow Spirits), Sam Schmidt on second fiddle (Alexander Bradshaw Band), and Kieran Riley on drums (Revel Makes). The band is currently recording its first full length album which will be released in May 2019.

performances.title: East Meets West
performances.description: Violin, Cello, Guitar (small amp), hand drums .. with belly dancers
performances.long_description: Original World Music music accompanied by belly dancers. https://www.facebook.com/Hejira-a-World-Music-Experience-205072802397/app/2405167945/

performances.title: Freeing your Voice
performances.description: Ithaca-based soul singer and teacher Elisa S. Keeler
performances.long_description: Elisa resides in Ithaca NY and has been teaching world music workshops since 2003. She is the founder of The Joy of Group Singing Program for adults and the grant funded Music For Unity and Social Change Program for public schools. She leads and sings with the Honey Child Soul Quintet. Elisa also sings harmony vocals with Travis Knapp and was the lead singer and song writer for the band Solstice. Her conscious soul album Red Sky was released in 2009. In 2011 Elisa became an assistant teacher of the Hidden Treasure Program, a 3-year course in healing and personal growth, at Light on the Hill Retreat Center.

performances.long_description: Solo Electric Guitar and vocals. Afrodelic/Rock/Blues

performances.long_description: The GIAC Jumpers is a 2nd-5th grade performance group from the Greater Ithaca Activities Center that entertain through African Dance, Step, and Jump Rope.

performances.title: Hilby the German Juggling Boy
performances.long_description: As a boy growing up in Berlin, young Hilby boasted no traumatic childhood experiences and exhibited no particular talents other than making funny faces at strangers and, as Hilby himself describes it, "breezing rhyzmically." Hilby grew up doing all the fun things that people do when they're not in school until they began to call him a grown-up. That's when he packed up his old kit bag, gave his mom a big kiss on the cheek, and set out on a journey that was to lead him all over the world.

performances.title: Hilby the German Juggling Boy
performances.long_description: As a boy growing up in Berlin, young Hilby boasted no traumatic childhood experiences and exhibited no particular talents other than making funny faces at strangers and, as Hilby himself describes it, "breezing rhyzmically." Hilby grew up doing all the fun things that people do when they're not in school until they began to call him a grown-up. performances.title: Ithaca Capoeira Center: Angola Quintal
performances.description: Live, percussive instruments with singing and acrobatics/balancing feats
performances.long_description: Capoeira is a martial art disguised as a dance. It was created by enslaved Africans in Brazil, and later spread across the world. A group of musicians play live instruments and sing songs while pairs of "capoeiristas" perform a sparring dances with each other, as playful games. There are impressive acrobatics, feats of balance, and narrow escapes from danger-- all wound together within a traditional and improvised dance.

performances.title: Ithaca Community Poets
performances.long_description: First Tompkins County Poet Laureate Katharyn Howd Machan's poems about dance, BELLY WORDS, come off the page with music by Taksim accompanying oral reading by local poets and interpretation by area dancers.

performances.title: Ithaca Concert Band
performances.long_description: The Ithaca Concert Band is entering it's 41st season as Ithaca's Premier Community Concert band. All of our members are volunteers, and we play a mixture of band classics and contemporary works.

performances.title: Ithaca Karate Harmony with Nature School
performances.long_description: the art and music of ithaca karate harmony with nature school.

performances.title: Jamelody
performances.long_description: Michael "Jamelody" Williams was born in Carenage Trinidad in 1980. The baby of six children, it was not long before his parents and older siblings realized that he was a very gifted vocalist and musician. As a member of this very spiritual family it was almost destined that young Michael would be part of the church choir. There, he expanded his vocal ability while embracing his religion. As a teenager he started to apply his vocal skills to making reggae compositions with sweet melodies and hooks in a style very characteristic of the R&B he had been singing earlier in his life but with rich cultural and spiritual content. This is why he took the name "Jamelody" (Jah Melody) It was at a captivating performance as an opening act for a reggae show in Port of Spain which brought him to the attention of his current manager who immediately took him to Jamaica to begin recording. On a second trip to Jamaica he was introduced to Bobby "Digital" Dixon, ace producer and owner of the well known record label Digital B. The sweet sound of Jamelody -- as heard on the single "Pressure", taken from his forthcoming VP album,to be released in September 2007 -- is a result of their amazing collaborative effort and musical chemistry.

performances.title: Janet Batch
performances.long_description: Alternative country music

performances.title: Jen Cork
performances.long_description: One woman. One pedal. One guitar. Worlds of harmony.

performances.title: Jennie Stearns
performances.long_description: Jennie Stearns is a classic American songwriter. By turns heartbreaking and hopeful, her songs are evocative, poignant and haunting. Quintessentially human. Her strong yet intimate vocal style and the vivid imagery portrayed by her lyrics gently draw the listener into her world. Despite the often sombre mood, you'll find yourself strangely at one with her perspective, akin to the intimate atmosphere of a late-night red-wine-confessional with a lifelong, much-loved friend.

performances.title: Josh Oxford CD Release
performances.long_description: Electronisist Josh Oxford, born in 1985, is a composer, arranger, and performer of myriad styles of music. Using his collection of vintage synthesizers, Josh is the leader of “The OXtet,” a jazz fusion ensemble for which Oxford composes all the music. He has performed throughout the country, especially in his native central New York, on piano, percussion, and Moog synthesizer.

performances.title: June with Chandani Belly Dance Troupe
performances.long_description: Middle Eastern Belly Dance - traditional Middle Eastern dances performed to Middle Eastern music from Egypt, Lebanon and Turkey in traditional costumes of these countries, under the direction of June Seaney, Professional Middle Eastern Belly Dancer, Instructor and Choreographer

performances.title: June with Chandani Belly Dance Troupe Cayuga
performances.long_description: Middle Eastern Belly Dance - traditional Middle Eastern dances performed to Middle Eastern music from Egypt, Lebanon and Turkey in traditional costumes of these countries, under the direction of June Seaney, Professional Middle Eastern Belly Dancer, Instructor and Choreographer

performances.title: Junkyard Theory
performances.long_description:
Junkyard Theory is downtempo electronic duo blurring the lines between a DJ set and a live performance. Touching on all genres from reggae to house and drum n bass, all of our music is originally produced and mixed live with an emphasis on extended jams and improvisation.

Fronted by the soaring flute and haunting, ethereal vocals of SensE and accompanied by sample-heavy, spacey beats and scratching from Proper Philth.

performances.title: KidBess and the Magic Ring
performances.long_description: Indie-rock

performances.title: Kurt Lichtmann
performances.long_description: Ithaca's favorite street singer sings Spanish language classical-pop vocal repertoire, all in Spanish. Recognize your Latino audience! Favorite Spanish songs from the repertoire of Julio Iglesias, Placido Domingo, Rolando Villazon, Antonio Banderas, and Andrea Bocelli (true, he is Italian, but his version of "Besame Mucho" is 2nd to none!) I will also give a short synopsis of each song in English for the gringos.

performances.title: Kurt Riley
performances.long_description: Metapop.

performances.title: Laila Belle
performances.long_description: Laila Belle plays original country music that rocks as much as it rolls!

performances.title: Li'l Anne and Hot Cayenne
performances.long_description: Take half a dozen groovemasters, add a spicy blend of rock ‘n’ roll, blues, and funk to the up-tempo Zydeco beat, and presto, you’ve got a dance groove that just won’t quit! Taking the Northeast Zydeco scene by storm, Li’l Anne & Hot Cayenne have been invited to play a variety of prestigious venues including the Rhythm and Roots Festival in Charlestown, RI, The Great Connecticut Cajun/Zydeco Music & Arts Festival, and the renowned Saratoga Springs Dance Flurry. In addition, the band has been invited to play venues typically reserved for Louisiana Zydeco bands such as Johnny D’s in Sommerville, MA, La Belle Époque, NYC; the TK Club, Phila., PA and the Somebody Scream Dance Series, Baltimore, MD. Li’l Anne & Hot Cayenne has also appeared with and provided back-up to Willis Prudhomme and has been invited on stage with Zydeco Force, Sean Ardoin and Zydekool, Leroy Thomas and Roy Carrier

performances.title: LilySilly Puppets
performances.long_description:
Aunt Irene' and the Witch

Aunt Irene’s show is filled with music and fantastic variety acts. See a singing sloth, the mysterious Linked Lizard, Rosita the flamenco dancer and Wanda the Wizard. Things seem to go awry as a needy witch casts spells to compete with acts and musical numbers. Live music by classically trained guitarist Matthew Ocone. Songs in Spanish, English, Russian and French.

performances.title: Maddy Walsh and The Blind Spots
performances.long_description: Homegrown, high-energy, female-fronted, socially conscious Moxy Rock

performances.title: Mark Rust
performances.long_description: Mark Rust is an Ithaca Festival favorite & tradition, performing at every Festival since 1978. The author of Ithaca’s unofficial anthem “Ithaca Sunset”, Mark sings songs about Ithaca, family & friends, as well as the ever popular Ithaca Festival Theme Songs he has written for each year.

performances.title: Mary Lorson and Billy Cote
performances.long_description: Original jazz-inflected artrock with multiple vocals and keyboardists

performances.title: Matthew Cornwell
performances.long_description: Matthew Cornwell is an emerging singer/songwriter out of Binghamton, NY. Delievering an eclectic blend of R&B, Rock, and Blues with originals and covers ranging from Stevie Wonder to Chris Stapleton, Matthew is quickly gaining a reputation for energy-packed shows that are enjoyable for all ages.

performances.title: Mbusi
performances.long_description: Born in south Africa, raised in ny. Mbusi is the truth. Pouring out his life experiences on every track singing with his talented voice. Touching the hearts and minds of every person he comes across. His music can be describe as mesmerizing. And as of late has been described as the r&b king. Take a minute and check out some of our videos..Join the movement of this talented new r&b musician

performances.title: Mirage Belly Dancers of Ithaca
performances.long_description: We are a multi-generational belly dance troupe originating out of Ithaca's Community School of Music and Arts. The troupe has been in existence for more than 30 years and we're still going strong. Invite us to join your next celebration!

performances.title: Mstr McBean
performances.long_description: Potentially mind blowing lyrics over absolutely mind blowing hip-hop beats, backed by one of the best drummers around and an electrifying DJ.

performances.title: Neo Project
performances.long_description: R&B Funk band

performances.title: One Heart Community drumming
performances.description: The drum circle is open to everyone
performances.long_description: One Heart Community Drumming is an open drum circle based in Ithaca, NY, welcoming all ages, levels of interest, and abilities. There is no specific "leader", rather we take turns facilitating the jam. It is helpful to bring your own drum but we usually have extras to share as well as shakers, bells etc.

performances.title: Palleon
performances.long_description: From Trumansburg, NY, the birthplace of Robert Moog's first modular synthesizer, comes Chris Ploss' "Palleon": groovy, hooky synthpop music.

performances.title: Papa Muse
performances.long_description:
Indie rock and world music with catchy hooks and funky dance-able grooves, Papa Muse has been compared to the Talking Heads, Vampire Weekend, Paul Simon, Devo and even Rush.

The songs are polished and often move in different directions to make them unpredictable and fresh and with meaningful lyrics they are relatable and easy to digest. The live show is dynamic and interactive, so while the message behind the music can be deep and introspective, the live show is light, whimsical and fun. "I want to inspire a sense of community empowerment and affect positive change, but without sounding preachy, so I try to keep my live show light and fun while singing about what matters most."

performances.title: Pete Panek & The Blue Cats
performances.long_description: High Energy Chicago Style Blues and Panek Originals

performances.long_description: A local DJ known for spinning disco, funk, house, and reggae.

performances.long_description: Local musician who loves to sing within and to the community! Enjoys performing an array of originals, upbeat covers, and unexpected mashups.

performances.long_description: A full performance of Panther on Piano (Full album on Spotify here: https://goo.gl/iZGt54) (Single from the album here: https://goo.gl/8jS3wC) with special guests. Possibly a teaser from upcoming food album.

performances.title: Road Man
performances.long_description: Funky soul and reggae!

performances.title: Rosie and the Bros
performances.long_description: Rose & The Bros are a powerhouse ensemble specializing in irresistible Zydeco and Cajun dance grooves resonating with sweet vocal harmonies and crooning country roots. With a shared dream to simply have a blast while making people dance without stopping, Rosie Newton, Paul Martin, and Steve Selin set out to collect tunes and the rare ingredients of a no holds barred Zydeco and Cajun dance party. Once the trio had found their undeniable rhythm section in drummer Greg Evans, bassist Angelo Peters, and rub board/triangle player Sally Freund, Rose & The Bros became a six piece instant party and the band was complete. Now, Rose & The Bros continue forward, gathering strength and a warm following with infectious joy, a love for community, and a rollicking good time.

performances.long_description: Festival Rock w/ Kieran Riley Makepeace, Juge Greenspun, Owen Erickson, Jason Shegogue

Seishi Karate Action Performances, Music, Demonstrations,

Family Entertainment & Fun.

performances.title: Strange Heavy
performances.long_description: Strange Heavy features hauntingly sultry vocals backed by bluesy cello and rocking guitar and drums. Two people, original music, just the right weight.

performances.title: Swamp Kids and Friends
performances.long_description: Swamp Kids' psychedelic blend of Folk/Rock/Funk/Roots is inspired by the sounds of yesterday and the possibilities of tomorrow.

performances.title: Taksim
performances.long_description: Taksim Ithaca plays well-known and uncommon songs from Arabic countries, Turkey, Greece, Iran, Jewish enclaves, and more. We are happy to bring this cultural richness to Ithaca.

performances.title: The Analogue Sons
performances.long_description: Dub Soul Rockers outfit features Lee Hamilton - saxophone, Michael Stark - organ, bass, synth, Lars Burggren - drum kit, Aaron Speiser - dubs, melodica, Alicia Aubin - trombone, and Jason Shegogue - guitar. The Analogue Sons fire up original uplifting sound, deep groove, triumphant melody, and distinct song.

performances.long_description: We are a local group, playing original music, in the genre of boot-stompin folk-punk and heavy-meadow, performing together for over 5 years. Featuring vocal harmonies, soaring violin, and a rockin rhythm section. We have played nearly every local music venue (including ithaca festival) and folks seem to like us.

performances.title: Thru Spectrums
performances.long_description: Thru Spectrums are a 7-piece, original funk rock band guaranteed to get your toes tapping and hips shaking.

performances.title: Vee Da Bee
performances.long_description: Vee Da Bee is a female-fronted powerhouse that'll have you singing and entertained.

performances.title: Venissa Santi
performances.long_description: Venissa’s artistry stems from the necessity to express the many influences that have nourished her spirit as a Cuban American. She was born in Ithaca, New York and hails from a long line of Cuban artists. But it was her grandfather, Jacobo Ros Capablanca, a Cuban composer who instilled in her a life-long passion for music.

performances.title: Vitamin L
performances.description: This is uplifting music for families of all ages
performances.long_description:
Vitamin L is a well-established singing group comprised of songwriter Jan Nigro and area youth, ages 11-21. They perform a delightful concert of uplifting songs from Vitamin L’s 5 nationally released, award winning recordings. Vitamin L works to help create a caring community of people who treat each other and the Earth with kindness and respect.

Vitamin L has given over 1,100 performances at schools, festivals and conferences in the last 30 years. An entertaining, energizing, uplifting concert!

performances.title: Zajal the Sugarplum Fairy--and Friends!
performances.long_description: Original story [I'll create a "steam" one this year somehow!] with lively recorded music and bright costumes (for all) combine to entertain children and taller people with zest and humor.

faq.question: What are the details of the parade?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival Parade is one of the city's greatest events every year! Please join us on Friday during Ithaca Festival to celebrate over one hundred community groups participating with costumes, music, dance, and togetherness. We will surely be Celebrating Like It's Our First! The parade will travel south on Cayuga Street from Lincoln Street to Court Street.

faq.question: How do I support the Ithaca Festival?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival is crowd sourced. We open applications for performers, food vendors, craft vendors and tablers at the beginning of each year. Stay tuned by checking our website and sign up for our newsletter.

faq.question: Why do I need to buy a button?
faq.answer: Good Question! Your button is your ticket to the festival. While we have many sources of revenue, the festival button is potentially the biggest. It supports Ithaca’s largest free outdoor music and arts event, performers, staff and all the other expenses that keep it going. This year, we are also offering button benefits including discounts at special deals between May 15th and June 15th at many participating local business as well as some really great prizes! You can find a list of participating businesses on our website. One prize basket will be drawn each day of the festival and our grand prize will be announced on Sunday, June 2 just before our final act takes the stage.

faq.question: How do I enter to win prizes?
Bathroom Locations
Charging Station
EMS
Lost Child
See something, Say something
Lost and Found
Food:
What are the Silent Discos?
faq.answer: Each​ partygoer will get one pair of comfortable, high-quality wireless headphones with independent volume control (in exchange for your I.D so you don't accidentally leave without​ returning the​m).​ The music will be transmitted from the DJ's equipment​ directly​ to everyone's ears. There will be 3 DJs spinning at all times. Each partygoer will be able to tune into 1 DJ at a time and switch as often as they like, and the color of the lights in the headphones will change accordingly. Find people with the same color lights and boogie to the same groove! Or do the opposite and see how weird you can get!

faq.question: When is it?
faq.answer: See the Ithaca Festival schedule for dates/times/location.

faq.question: Who is playing?
Is there a Facebook event page?
What are the details of the parade?
faq.answer:
The Ithaca Festival Parade is one of the city's greatest events every year! Please join us on Thursday during Ithaca Festival to celebrate over one hundred community groups participating with costumes, music, dance, and togetherness. We will surely be Celebrating Like It's Our First!

5:45pm: Ithaca Youth Bureau Festival Mile 6:30pm: Ithaca Festival Parade The parade will travel south on Cayuga Street from Lincoln Street to Court Street.

faq.question: How else can I get involved?
faq.answer: The Ithaca Festival is crowd sourced. We open applications for performers, food vendors, craft vendors and tablers at the beginning of each year. Stay tuned by checking our website and sign up for our newsletter.

faq.question: What is the price of admission?
faq.answer: The festival is free, though we encourage the purchase of a $5 button to support our event. Some special events may charge additional fees.

faq.question: What are the hours of the festival?
faq.answer:
Ithaca Festival begins at noon on Friday, with the parade occurring at 6:30 that evening. Music, food, crafts, and other activities are open to the public Friday-Sunday for the following hours. Certain special events occur at various locations after hours.

Food Vendors Friday: Noon-10pm Saturday: 11am-10pm Sunday 11am-8pm Craft Vendors Friday Noon-8pm Saturday 10am-8pm Sunday 10am-7pm Music Performances: Friday Noon-10pm Saturday 11am-10pm Sunday 11am-9pm

faq.question: How can I get a schedule of events?
faq.answer:
You can find printed programs at various downtown locations, including Wegmans.

You can also view details about performers here: Performer Schedule Special Ev_x007f_ents

faq.question: Where can I find information about vendors?
faq.answer:
Food Vendors

Participating food vendors can be found along the 100 block of W. MLK Jr. St. between Cayuga and Geneva Streets. Craft Vendors Participating craft vendors can be found along Cayuga St. between Green and Court. The craft fair is organized and managed by the Downtown Ithaca Alliance. For more information, please contact Tatiana Sy at 607-277-8679.

faq.question: Where can I park during the festival?
faq.answer:
There are several parking options in downtown Ithaca during Ithaca Festival, including three nearby parking garages and many metered parking spaces. Parking garages are noted on the Ithaca Festival Map. Neighborhood parking is also available. Walking, biking, using public transportation, and carpooling are highly encouraged.

Parking Garage Fees Friday: $1/hour or $7 for the day Saturday: $5 for the day Sunday: $5 for the day
